trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Lafayette
There were no other sightings in Lafayette on or around May 22nd 2007
divs: sighting detailswe are located in lafayette indiana in a subdivision near the intersection of hwy 65 and hwy 26. last night at approximately 10pm my husband and i decided to walk our two small dogs. we were walking in the direction of hwy 26 east when i spotted two large circles\flashes of light in the sky very near each other--they were light orange in color. by the time i could get out "omg are those planes on fire?!?" they had disappeared. then two small specs of white light (almost like distant stars) were seen flashing quickley in the sky in different directions. my husband joked that "maybe it's a ufo". as we rounded the corner i spotted an adult male and three children standing on their driveway staring up. my husband said "i bet they saw what you saw". i went up to the man and asked him "did you see that?". he said "yes the ufo's? they have been doing this pattern for about two weeks". he then went on to explain that he has witnessed this same kind of event for the past two weeks from his backyard at night. he stated that generally the two small specs of light come together turn orange and then race away. he said that generally it happens around every 15 minutes or so. as we spoke with him we could see the specs of light (5-6 of them) racing around the sky at what i would imagine to be very high speeds. there were planes also in the sky but they were very self evident as to what they were. we did not stay very long and went back to the house. my husband went outside with binoculars to see anything but did not witness the orange light happenings. the entire event was quite creepy and i really do not have explanation for it. i do not really believe one way or the other in alien life or ufo's but it was very evident that what i witnessed last night was surely not run of the mill plane activity.
Summary: Two large balls of light orange spotted close together then dissappearing and reappearing as small dots flashing (like stars) traveling very fast around the sky (multiple of the small flash--5-6)
